description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek columnist Joshua Green takes an early look at the impact of Trump’s guilty verdict on the presidential race. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Felony Factor and the Biden-Trump Race for the White House

description: The guilty verdict in Donald Trump’s Manhattan criminal trial injects an explosive and unpredictable new variable into a presidential race locked in stasis, distinguished primarily by voter frustrations with their choice of two well-known and unpopular major candidates.
title: Trump Guilty Verdict Adds Twist to 2024 Race: A Convicted Felon

description: President Joe Biden’s advisers have insisted for months to allies at home and abroad that his embrace of Israel has resulted in the least bad outcome in the Gaza war by reining in Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s impulses and preventing even worse bloodshed.
title: Biden Sticks to ‘Tightrope’ Israel Policy While Rafah Deaths Mount

description: The US Justice Department is closely monitoring deals that artificial intelligence companies like OpenAI have been reaching with content creators, said Jonathan Kanter, the agency’s top antitrust official.
title: AI Content Deals Face Antitrust Spotlight, Top US Official Says

description: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis insisted her first budget won’t keep interest rates high for longer even as economists warned it may complicate the central bank’s efforts to tame inflation.
title: Willis Says New Zealand Budget Is Friend, Not Foe, to RBNZ

description: The US and Chinese military chiefs managed little more than a handshake before dinner during an annual defense conference in Singapore last year. This time around they’re aiming higher, but not by much.
title: US, China Defense Chiefs Seek More Than a Handshake in Singapore

description: A jury in former President Donald Trump’s criminal hush-money trial took just two days to reach a historic verdict: guilty on all 34 counts.
title: Trump Is Guilty on All Counts in Hush-Money Case. Now What?

description: The jury that convicted Donald Trump of falsifying business records had been inundated with testimony and evidence for almost five weeks before issuing the historic verdict, but several key moments stood out and likely influenced the panel during the Manhattan trial.
title: Here Are the Key Trump Trial Moments That Led to Guilty Verdict

description: Donald Trump is seeking to spin his criminal conviction into gold with an appeal to donors to contribute money to his newly embattled presidential campaign.
title: Trump Campaign Sends Appeal for Donations After Guilty Verdict

description: Donald Trump at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York on May 2. Photographer: Mark Peterson/Getty Images
title: Trump Found Guilty in Hush-Money Trial

description: Russia fired ballistic missiles provided by North Korea against Ukrainian forces in the country’s northeast, the Defense Intelligence Agency said in a report, offering fresh evidence of a deepening military alliance between the two US adversaries.
title: Russia Is Using North Korean Missiles in Ukraine, US Agency Says

description: A New York jury found Donald Trump guilty of multiple felonies at his hush-money trial, making him the first former US president to be convicted of crimes.
title: Donald Trump Found Guilty on All Counts in NY Hush Money Case

description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s ruling party was put on the defensive on government-controlled state television as contenders for next month’s European Parliament election held the first televised debate in the country in 18 years.
title: First TV Debate in 18 Years Is Sign of Change in Orban’s Hungary

description: President Joe Biden will allow Ukraine to launch US-provided munitions against military targets inside a limited area of Russia, overcoming concern that any such move could provoke a wider war with the West.
title: Biden Allows Ukraine to Hit Some Russia Targets With US Weapons

description: Canada needs to be “super proactive” about the looming review of the North American free-trade agreement given that it’s a junior partner in the deal, its former central bank chief warned.
title: Poloz Urges Canada to Get Ahead of Looming US-Mexico Trade Talks

description: President Joe Biden plans to sign an executive order tightening measures at the US-Mexico border as soon as Tuesday, seeking to address an historic surge in migrants that has become a major political liability ahead of November’s general election.
title: Biden Is Readying New Order to Tighten Asylum Process at Border

description: Germany is providing as much as €500 million ($542 million) in additional military aid to Ukraine, including air-defense missiles, Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said.
title: Germany Announces New €500 Million Weapons Package for Ukraine

description: Keir Starmer’s purge of the left wing of his Labour Party has had a single, laser-focused aim: to make Britain’s opposition electable again after over a decade in the cold. But an escalating row over the treatment of the UK’s first Black woman MP risks undermining his control of the UK election campaign.
title: Starmer Purge of Labour Left Risks Undermining Election Campaign

description: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman is likely to support Donald Trump in November’s election, according to a person familiar with his thinking.
title: Bill Ackman Is Likely to Endorse Trump After Backing Longshot Candidates

description: Javier Milei’s packed European tour in mid-June will also include a bilateral meeting with French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris, according to government officials familiar with the Argentine leader’s plans.
title: Milei to Meet Macron in Paris During Packed European Tour

description: House Financial Services Chairman Patrick McHenry put the onus on Senate Democrats to move sweeping crypto legislation before the November election.
title: GOP’s McHenry Pressures Schumer to Move Ahead on Crypto Bills

description: Chief Justice John Roberts rejected a request to meet with Democratic senators to discuss the Supreme Court’s ethics controversies, including recent revelations that flags associated with right-wing causes flew at Justice Samuel Alito’s houses.
title: Chief Justice Roberts Refuses Meeting With Democratic Lawmakers

description: Miriam Adelson, one of the wealthiest women in Republican circles, intends to donate to Donald Trump, according to people briefed on the matter, giving the former president a huge financial boost heading into the November election.
title: Billionaire Miriam Adelson Plans to Give Millions to Help Trump

description: Mexico’s next president will inherit a country in a unique position to benefit from seismic changes in international trade. It’s also a country with no shortage of issues, from persistent crime to infrastructure woes. On June 2, voters will head to the polls to determine the successor of President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, also known as AMLO. Whichever woman wins — the ruling party’s candidate Claudia Sheinbaum or opposition candidate Xochitl Galvez — will then look to continue the country’s
title: The 10 Economic Challenges Mexico’s Next President Will Face

description: The race to become Iceland’s president tightened just two days before the election, with the top three candidates in close proximity in three polls published Thursday.
title: Iceland’s Presidential Polls Show Lead Candidates in Tight Race

description: Outgoing Conservative Member of Parliament Mark Logan announced his backing for the Labour opposition in the UK general election on July 4, saying the governing Tories have become “unrecognizable” from the party he joined.
title: Outgoing Tory MP Logan Backs Labour in Campaign Blow to Sunak

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is close to completing talks on a bilateral security agreement with Ukraine, according to a US official, a move intended to cement longer-term support for Kyiv in its war against Russia’s invasion.
title: US Nears Bilateral Security Pact With Ukraine in Show of Support

description: A United Nations tribute to Iran’s late President Ebrahim Raisi, killed in a helicopter crash this month, showcased deep divisions in the world body, as many nations praised his legacy while the US and Israel boycotted the event.
title: UN Tribute to Iran’s Raisi Underscores Divide in World Body

description: Just hours after South African President Cyril Ramaphosa confidently predicted that the ruling party would easily retain its three-decade stranglehold on politics, it was increasingly clear that voters had other ideas — sending the country into uncharted terrain.
title: South Africa’s ANC Has No Good Options as Majority Vanishes

description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump are discussing cryptocurrency policy as the former president increasingly highlights Bitcoin and other digital assets on the campaign trail as a way to reach new voters, according to a person familiar with the talks.
title: Musk Counsels Trump on Crypto in Sign of Billionaire’s Sway

description: The New York jury that will decide Donald Trump’s fate began its second day of deliberations Thursday by listening again to testimony about how the National Enquirer publisher took a negative story about Trump “off the market.”
title: Trump Jury Rehears Account of How Tabloid Buried Model’s Story

description: Deputy Labour leader Angela Rayner said veteran Member of Parliament Diane Abbott should be allowed to stand again in the July 4 general election, suggesting a split at the top of the party over the treatment of the left-wing MP.
title: Starmer’s Deputy Says Veteran MP Abbott Should Stand in Election

description: Mozambique’s next payment from the International Monetary Fund is at risk of being delayed because of the African nation’s ballooning public wage bill, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
title: Mozambique’s Surging Wage Bill May Delay IMF Payment to 2025

description: Criminal gangs have been enlisted to attack Israeli interests in Sweden at the behest of Iran, according to Israeli and Swedish security services.
title: Iran-Backed Gangs Blamed for Israeli Embassy Attacks in Sweden

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni looks set to engineer the first presidential encounter between Argentina’s Javier Milei and Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva at the Group of Seven summit next month, while the Pope is also due to attend for the first time.
title: Meloni Is Bringing Together an Explosive Cast of Characters for Her G-7 Summit

description: The political party of Benny Gantz, a member of the Israeli war cabinet, said it wants to dissolve the parliament in a bid to force early elections and oust Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
title: Gantz’s Party Proposes Vote to Dissolve Israel’s Parliament

description: Former South African President Jacob Zuma’s party signaled it’s open to a coalition deal with like-minded rivals, having won enough support in national elections to help erase the majority of the ruling African National Congress.
title: Zuma’s Party Signals It’s Open to Any Coalitions in South Africa

description: A senior Czech official urged allies to step up financing for an initiative aimed at delivering ammunition to Ukraine, saying only a quarter of those who made commitments had come through on financing.
title: Czechs Warn Funding Is Lagging on Ammunition Plan for Ukraine

description: French president Emmanuel Macron is set to host his US counterpart Joe Biden next week as the two leaders seek to step up cooperation on Ukraine.
title: Biden to Visit France for Meeting With Macron Ahead of Summits

description: As soon as it became clear that Ferdinand Marcos Jr. had won the Philippine presidential election in May 2022, the nation’s ambassador to the US was asked by the White House when President Joe Biden should give him a congratulatory call.
title: Marcos’ Surprising Embrace of US Puts China on Back Foot

description: Efforts by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives to follow Donald Trump’s playbook by attacking Labour leader Keir Starmer over his age have fallen flat, an opinion poll found, as senior Tories criticized the US-style rhetoric used in the UK campaign.
title: Trump-Style Tory Attacks on Starmer’s Age Backfired, Poll Says

description: Romania’s premier came under renewed pressure to lift wages amid protests from his own staff, who pilloried civil-servant pay levels in the Black Sea nation and said an approved 10% increase so far isn’t enough.
title: Struggling With Deficit, Romanian Premier Confronts Wage Demands

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: India’s City of Joy Appears Reluctant to Cheer for Modi in Elections

description: Britain’s richest households are bearing the brunt of stickier inflation and high interest rates, a reversal of earlier trends when the poorest was squeezed hardest.
title: Britain’s Richest Hit Most by Inflation and High Interest Rates

description: Lai Ching-te’s tumultuous first ten days as Taiwan’s president signal he’s going to be more hamstrung than his predecessor in bolstering the island’s defenses, even as Beijing ramps up military threats.
title: Taiwan Leader’s Bid to Keep China at Bay Risks Being Hamstrung

description: An Indonesian court eased the minimum age limit for candidates for Jakarta governor, which is widely seen as paving the way for President Joko Widodo’s youngest son to run for the post.
title: Ruling May Allow Jokowi’s Son to Run for Jakarta Governor

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Hard Reality Check for Taiwan and Its Western Allies

description: The Spanish parliament on Thursday gave final approval to a controversial amnesty law that will lift the threat of criminal charges against Catalan separatist leaders and hundreds of supporters.
title: Spain Approves Catalan Amnesty Law Allowing Puigdemont’s Return

description: The European Union agreed to hike tariffs on imports of Russian grain to curb the Kremlin’s revenues and prevent those shipments from destabilizing the region’s farm sector.
title: EU Agrees to Hike Tariffs on Russian Grain Imports From July

description: India’s former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh criticized Narendra Modi’s comments on the election campaign trail as divisive and urged voters to cast their ballots against his “despotic regime.”
title: India’s Former Prime Minister Slams Modi for ‘Hateful’ Language

description: It may be a presidential rematch, but it's not the same electorate as in 2020
title: The 2024 Election Won’t Be Up To the Same Voters Who Chose Biden

description: The Biden administration’s antitrust enforcers are hosting a major event on competition in artificial intelligence Thursday, but some of the biggest names in the industry aren’t invited to speak.
title: Google, Meta, Microsoft Snubbed From US AI Competition Forum

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is starting to regain his popularity after struggling politically for more than a year, out-polling main rival Benny Gantz for the first time since the war against Hamas started in October.
title: Netanyahu’s Popularity on the Rise in Blow to Israeli Rivals

description: The UK’s governing Conservatives would keep income tax thresholds frozen until 2028 if they stay in power, Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said, confirming an effective tax rise on earnings and undermining the core message in the Tory election campaign that is built around tax cuts.
title: Hunt Says Tax Will Rise After UK Vote in Blow to Tory Messaging

description: South Africa’s rand fell Thursday as initial forecasts for the general election showed a marked decline in support for the ruling African National Congress.
title: South African Rand Drops as Election Forecast Shows ANC Decline

description: South Africa’s ruling party looks set to fall well short of obtaining a parliamentary majority for the first time since it came to power at the end of apartheid three decades ago, a model developed by a state research agency shows. The rand weakened.
title: South Africa’s ANC Punished by Voters, Model Shows

description: Russia attempted to strike military targets in Ukraine overnight with a barrage of missiles and drones, after Sweden said it will provide Kyiv with surveillance aircraft to be deployed with fighter jets from other European nations.
title: Russia Fires Missile Barrage Against Military Targets in Ukraine

description: South Africans woke to early results showing the ruling party at risk of losing its parliamentary majority for the first time since taking power at the end of apartheid three decades ago.
title: South Africa’s ANC Loses Some Ground In Early Vote Tally

description: Without a politically perilous reallocation of spending, the country risks an exodus of tech investment.
title: Israel’s Military Ramp-Up Threatens Another ‘Lost Decade’

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping outlined a range of areas including finance and technology in which his nation can enhance cooperation with Arab nations, underscoring Beijing’s push for greater influence in Middle East.
title: Xi Lays Out Vision for Greater Cooperation With Arab States

description: El periodo de campañas presidenciales de México cierra con una ventaja de 21 puntos de Claudia Sheinbaum, por encima de su rival más cercana Xóchitl Gálvez, según el Barómetro Electoral Bloomberg.
title: Campaña de México finaliza con ventaja de 21 puntos para Sheinbaum

description: Mexico's presidential campaign closes with Claudia Sheinbaum holding a 21-point lead over her closest rival, Xóchitl Gálvez, according to data aggregated by the Bloomberg Poll Tracker.
title: Mexico Campaign Ends With 21 Point Advantage for Sheinbaum

description: A Hong Kong court found 14 opposition figures guilty in the city’s largest-yet national security trial that targeted scores of pro-democracy activists.
title: Hong Kong Finds 14 Guilty in Biggest National Security Case

description: New Zealand’s new center-right government delivered on its election promise to cut taxes in its first budget even as the Treasury forecast bigger deficits and a delayed return to surplus.
title: New Zealand Government Cuts Taxes Even as Budget Deficit Widens

description: Mexico’s presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum saw her commanding lead in some opinion polls narrow less than a week before election day in Latin America’s second-biggest economy.
title: Sheinbaum’s Lead Narrows Days Before Mexico’s Election

description: President Javier Milei’s main legislative attempt to deregulate Argentina’s economy is one step closer to a decisive vote after weeks of stalemate in the opposition-controlled upper chamber.
title: Milei’s Sweeping Deregulation Plan Passes First Senate Hurdle
